name: ammonium paratungstate production, ion exchange | ammonium paratungstate | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/22855/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 Kg ammonium paratungstate (APT) by the hydrometallur-gical method of caustic autoclave-ion exchange (solid ion exchange SIX). More than 90 % of APT pro-duced in China is produced in this manner (Ma et al. 2017). ATP has the chemical formula (NH4)10(H2W12O42) 4H2O and is the most important intermediate product for all tungsten products (Lassner et al. 2000).Due to lack of data, this dataset does not include any recycling processes. Tung-sten recycling rate in China is significantly lower compared to the global rate (10-24 %) (Furberg et al. 2019). ;Furberg, A., Arvidsson, R., Molander, S., 2019. Environmental life cycle assessment of cemented carbide (WC-Co) production. J. Clean. Prod. 209, 1126–1138. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jclepro.2018.10.272;Lassner, E., Schubert, W.-D., Lüderitz, E., Wolf, H.U., 2000. Tungsten, Tungsten Alloys, and Tungsten Compounds. In 'Ullmann’s Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry'. Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA, Weinheim, Germany, pp. 1–53. https://doi.org/10.1002/14356007.a27_22;Ma, X., Qi, C., Ye, L., Yang, D., Hong, J., 2017. Life cycle assessment of tungsten carbide powder production: A case study in China. J. Clean. Prod. 149, 936–944. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jclepro.2017.02.184

	The activity starts when the raw material enters the process

This activity ends with the production of 1 Kg APT.
category: C:Manufacturing/24:Manufacture of basic metals/242:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals/2420:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset represents Chinese APT production using caustic autoclave-ion exchange (solid ion ex-change SIX). Chinese APT production makes up 67 % of global production.;;The dataset is  based on a published inventory by Ma et al. (2017) which represents tungsten mining and tungsten carbide sites located in Jiangsu (CN) and Jiangxi Province (CN), respectively. It is unclear how many productions sites were taken into account for this study.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: ;This dataset represents the production of APT using caustic autoclave-ion exchange (solid ion ex-change SIX). Digestion is performed with NaOH solution. A rough sodium tungstate (Na2WO4) solu-tion is obtained via filtration. After dilution of the Na2WO4 solution with water, ion exchange tech-nology is used to convert Na2WO4 to ammonium tungstate ((NH4)2WO4) and to remove impurities such as sodium, arsenic, silicon, vanadium and phosphorus. Tungsten is first adsorbed to the ion exchange resin and afterwards desorption takes place by washing the resin with ammonium chloride solution, ammonium hydroxide and deionized water. Subsequently, ammonium sulfide and a copper compound are used to remove molybdenum and other impurities. (Shen et al. 2019). APT production via the solid ion exchange technology causes the production of large amount of waste water with high salinity (Shen et al. 2019).;;Shen, L., Li, X., Lindberg, D., Taskinen, P., 2019. Tungsten extractive metallurgy: A review of processes and their challenges for sustainability. Miner. Eng. 142. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.mineng.2019.105934
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
Based on literature data: 

Ma, X., Qi, C., Ye, L., Yang, D., Hong, J., 2017. Life cycle assessment of tungsten carbide powder production: A case study in China. J. Clean. Prod. 149, 936-944. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jclepro.2017.02.184
